response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 19, the individual falls into a high-risk age group for recidivism as younger offenders statistically face higher rates of re-arrest."],
    ["Race", "medium", "Being Black has been correlated with differential treatment in criminal justice settings, which may contribute indirectly to recidivism risk."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Multiple arrests and convictions indicate a pattern of criminal behavior, strongly elevating the recidivism risk."],
    ["Education", "high", "Lack of a high school diploma or GED is a significant risk factor as lower educational attainment is associated with higher recidivism."],
    ["Employment", "high", "The absence of employment or job engagement is linked to higher risk for re-arrest due to economic instability and lack of structured schedules."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use contributes moderately to risk, although the type of substance and severity can vary in impact."],
    ["Marital Status / Living Situation", "medium", "Living alone with no marital ties can be associated with reduced social support, moderately increasing risk."],
    ["Household Background", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household with multiple members can expose one to environments with higher crime exposure, moderately raising the risk."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "A belief that a higher power influences personal events can serve as a coping mechanism, generally not contributing significantly to recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: At 19, the individual falls into a high-risk age group for recidivism as younger offenders statistically face higher rates of re-arrest.
Being Black has been correlated with differential treatment in criminal justice settings, which may contribute indirectly to recidivism risk.
Multiple arrests and convictions indicate a pattern of criminal behavior, strongly elevating the recidivism risk.
Lack of a high school diploma or GED is a significant risk factor as lower educational attainment is associated with higher recidivism.
The absence of employment or job engagement is linked to higher risk for re-arrest due to economic instability and lack of structured schedules.
Recent marijuana use contributes moderately to risk, although the type of substance and severity can vary in impact.
Living alone with no marital ties can be associated with reduced social support, moderately increasing risk.
Growing up in an urban household with multiple members can expose one to environments with higher crime exposure, moderately raising the risk.
A belief that a higher power influences personal events can serve as a coping mechanism, generally not contributing significantly to recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 4 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 7 inches and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
